    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;

          min-height: 100%;
        }

          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {

          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;

            border: 0;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the wasm part.<span class="line"><!---->See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the wasm part.<!----></span><br><br># Renderer Bug<span class="line"><!----># Renderer Bug<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<span class="line"><!---->When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<!----></span><br><br>However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<span class="line"><!---->However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<!----></span><br><br>1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<span class="line"><!---->1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<!----></span><br>2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<span class="line"><!---->2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<!----></span><br>3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<span class="line"><!---->3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<span class="line"><!---->Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        We use the resource URL as the key, so I think a robust fix for this would be to generate a checksum on the code in the browser process to prevent the server from switching the contents as above.<span class="line"><!---->We use the resource URL as the key, so I think a robust fix for this would be to generate a checksum on the code in the browser process to prevent the server from switching the contents as above.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        I'm not sure how the first "confused" fetch can get the cached module from the second caching fetch. My understanding of ResourceLoader is that the code cache fetch is started at the same time as the resource fetch. Is it possible for the second fetch to generate the code and cache it before the first fetch tries to get it?<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure how the first "confused" fetch can get the cached module from the second caching fetch. My understanding of ResourceLoader is that the code cache fetch is started at the same time as the resource fetch. Is it possible for the second fetch to generate the code and cache it before the first fetch tries to get it?<!----></span><br><br>To clarify my suggestion in #8, I think the resource checksum must be computed in the renderer, as the browser wouldn't have an easy way to associate the code with the resource. The checksum could be appended to the resource URL used as a key to prevent this confusion.<span class="line"><!---->To clarify my suggestion in #8, I think the resource checksum must be computed in the renderer, as the browser wouldn't have an easy way to associate the code with the resource. The checksum could be appended to the resource URL used as a key to prevent this confusion.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

        > My understanding of ResourceLoader is that the code cache fetch is started at the same time as the resource fetch. Is it possible for the second fetch to generate the code and cache it before the first fetch tries to get it?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; My understanding of ResourceLoader is that the code cache fetch is started at the same time as the resource fetch. Is it possible for the second fetch to generate the code and cache it before the first fetch tries to get it?<!----></span><br><br>Yes, that's my understanding too. The fetch (both code cache and the resource) is asynchronous. So, I could imagine the case (though unlikely) where the second fetch is serviced before the first one. Though we match response times to ensure that the cached code corresponds to the fetched resource [1]. So I am not sure how how we could use the wrong code.  Is there a case where the response time matches for the first and second requests? I thought if they are different resources I think response_time would be updated too.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, that's my understanding too. The fetch (both code cache and the resource) is asynchronous. So, I could imagine the case (though unlikely) where the second fetch is serviced before the first one. Though we match response times to ensure that the cached code corresponds to the fetched resource [1]. So I am not sure how how we could use the wrong code.  Is there a case where the response time matches for the first and second requests? I thought if they are different resources I think response_time would be updated too.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/loader/fetch/resource_loader.cc;l=380;drc=b6ce9909d733600593342da7f9d153d5cd9c532e;bpv=1;bpt=1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/loader/fetch/resource_loader.cc;l=380;drc=b6ce9909d733600593342da7f9d153d5cd9c532e;bpv=1;bpt=1"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/loader/fetch/resource_loader.cc;l=380;drc=b6ce9909d733600593342da7f9d153d5cd9c532e;bpv=1;bpt=1<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        any chance the cache entry for the first fetch is kept open for the duration for the second? If so, they may end up sharing the entry; a solution may be be to Doom the currently open entry for a key on Write (just dooming it by key before create may be enough and I think should perform OK).<span class="line"><!---->any chance the cache entry for the first fetch is kept open for the duration for the second? If so, they may end up sharing the entry; a solution may be be to Doom the currently open entry for a key on Write (just dooming it by key before create may be enough and I think should perform OK).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        Hi, hope this helps.<span class="line"><!---->Hi, hope this helps.<!----></span><br><br>1. > any chance the cache entry for the first fetch is kept open for the duration for the second? <span class="line"><!---->1. &gt; any chance the cache entry for the first fetch is kept open for the duration for the second? <!----></span><br><br>The first fetch of .wasm resource did not generate any cache, because the web server didn't set any cache control hint in the response HTTP headers.<span class="line"><!---->The first fetch of .wasm resource did not generate any cache, because the web server didn't set any cache control hint in the response HTTP headers.<!----></span><br><br>2. The second time web server would set 'last-modified' in headers and we compile the .wasm resource using `compileStreaming`. In this case, Chrome would cache both the .wasm resource and the compiled wasm code.<span class="line"><!---->2. The second time web server would set 'last-modified' in headers and we compile the .wasm resource using `compileStreaming`. In this case, Chrome would cache both the .wasm resource and the compiled wasm code.<!----></span><br><br>3. Chrome use the URL as key to search existing resource cache, so when compiling .wasm resource fetched in the first time, Chrome would think that there already exists resource cache and then try to get corresponding code cache.<span class="line"><!---->3. Chrome use the URL as key to search existing resource cache, so when compiling .wasm resource fetched in the first time, Chrome would think that there already exists resource cache and then try to get corresponding code cache.<!----></span><br><br>Although the response_time of two fetches are different, Chrome did not verify it before using the code cache. So I think computing a checksum and verify it later, or just verifying the response_time is good enough to fix this bug.<span class="line"><!---->Although the response_time of two fetches are different, Chrome did not verify it before using the code cache. So I think computing a checksum and verify it later, or just verifying the response_time is good enough to fix this bug.<!----></span><br><br>I've tested the fix in #15, it prevents the type confusion and throws a js exception : "Uncaught (in promise) CompileError: WebAssembly.compileStreaming(): Compiling function #5:"get_2" failed: invalid global index: 2 @+46066".<span class="line"><!---->I've tested the fix in #15, it prevents the type confusion and throws a js exception : "Uncaught (in promise) CompileError: WebAssembly.compileStreaming(): Compiling function #5:"get_2" failed: invalid global index: 2 @+46066".<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>

      <div class="issue-diff">

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        I *think* a malicious web developer can circumvent the time check with service worker.<span class="line"><!---->I *think* a malicious web developer can circumvent the time check with service worker.<!----></span><br><br>// In sw<span class="line"><!---->// In sw<!----></span><br>let flag = true;<span class="line"><!---->let flag = true;<!----></span><br>const init = ...;<span class="line"><!---->const init = ...;<!----></span><br>const bodyA = ...;<span class="line"><!---->const bodyA = ...;<!----></span><br>const bodyB = ...;<span class="line"><!---->const bodyB = ...;<!----></span><br>self.addEventListener('fetch', (e) => {<span class="line"><!---->self.addEventListener('fetch', (e) =&gt; {<!----></span><br>  const req = e.req;<span class="line"><!---->  const req = e.req;<!----></span><br>  if (req.url === ...) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (req.url === ...) {<!----></span><br>    e.respondWith(new Response(flag ? bodyA : bodyB, init));<span class="line"><!---->    e.respondWith(new Response(flag ? bodyA : bodyB, init));<!----></span><br>    flag = !flag;<span class="line"><!---->    flag = !flag;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br><br>My assumptions (possibly wrong) here is, the response time for a response created in a service worker is always 0.<span class="line"><!---->My assumptions (possibly wrong) here is, the response time for a response created in a service worker is always 0.<!----></span><br><br>This service worker serves two responses for the same URL, and the same response time and different bodies.<span class="line"><!---->This service worker serves two responses for the same URL, and the same response time and different bodies.<!----></span><br><br>+flaken@, please correct me if I'm wrong.<span class="line"><!---->+flaken@, please correct me if I'm wrong.<!----></span><br><br>Thanks,<span class="line"><!---->Thanks,<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

I believe the response time check that code caching uses was always meant to be a short-term solution: see <!----></span>issue 1099587<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1099587" title="Use unique identifier rather than timestamps for verifying V8 code cache entries"><!---->issue 1099587<!----></a>. As<span class="line"><!---->Stop storing the ScriptCachedMetadataHandler in RawResource. As<!----></span><br>RawResource has only one client, we can dispatch the given cached<span class="line"><!---->RawResource has only one client, we can dispatch the given cached<!----></span><br>metadata without compromising ownership. Have BodyStreamBuffer store<span class="line"><!---->metadata without compromising ownership. Have BodyStreamBuffer store<!----></span><br>the ScriptCachedMetadataHandler so that the WASM implementation can<span class="line"><!---->the ScriptCachedMetadataHandler so that the WASM implementation can<!----></span><br>get the handler easily.<span class="line"><!---->get the handler easily.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1146673<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }

    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      <chops-dialog>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by wfh@chromium.org (Nov 6, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the wasm part.<span class="line"><!---->See parent bug for full exploit. This is for the wasm part.<!----></span><br><br># Renderer Bug<span class="line"><!----># Renderer Bug<!----></span><br><br>## Details<span class="line"><!---->## Details<!----></span><br><br>When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<span class="line"><!---->When compiling large wasm code, chrome would serialize the compiled code as code cache and reuse it if the wasm resource is requested a second time. For now, WebAssembly caching is only implemented for the streaming API calls such as `compileStreaming`.<!----></span><br><br>However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<span class="line"><!---->However, the validation of wasm cache hit is insufficient. If attacker<!----></span><br><br>1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<span class="line"><!---->1. Fetch a wasm resource (called *res_a*) from server without any cache control hint. and then<!----></span><br>2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<span class="line"><!---->2. Fetch a wasm resource with the same origin, but this time, the server will return a different resource file (called *res_b*) and tell chrome to cache it.<!----></span><br>3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<span class="line"><!---->3. Compile *res_a* , and chrome would reuse the code cache generated for *res_b* which results in type confusion.<!----></span><br><br>## Exploitation<span class="line"><!---->## Exploitation<!----></span><br><br>Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<span class="line"><!---->Untagged WebAssembly global values are stored in a ArrayBuffer. The bounds check of accessing a global value is done in compile phase. As such, we can cause OOB access on partition heap by leveraging the type confusion bug and then achieves RCE.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This may also affect the JavaScript code cache, which stores Ignition Bytecode rather than native code.<span class="line"><!---->This may also affect the JavaScript code cache, which stores Ignition Bytecode rather than native code.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        We use the resource URL as the key, so I think a robust fix for this would be to generate a checksum on the code in the browser process to prevent the server from switching the contents as above.<span class="line"><!---->We use the resource URL as the key, so I think a robust fix for this would be to generate a checksum on the code in the browser process to prevent the server from switching the contents as above.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146673#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Nov 8, 2020, 10:07 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146673#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Sun, Nov 8, 2020, 10:07 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I'm not sure how the first "confused" fetch can get the cached module from the second caching fetch. My understanding of ResourceLoader is that the code cache fetch is started at the same time as the resource fetch. Is it possible for the second fetch to generate the code and cache it before the first fetch tries to get it?<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure how the first "confused" fetch can get the cached module from the second caching fetch. My understanding of ResourceLoader is that the code cache fetch is started at the same time as the resource fetch. Is it possible for the second fetch to generate the code and cache it before the first fetch tries to get it?<!----></span><br><br>To clarify my suggestion in #8, I think the resource checksum must be computed in the renderer, as the browser wouldn't have an easy way to associate the code with the resource. The checksum could be appended to the resource URL used as a key to prevent this confusion.<span class="line"><!---->To clarify my suggestion in #8, I think the resource checksum must be computed in the renderer, as the browser wouldn't have an easy way to associate the code with the resource. The checksum could be appended to the resource URL used as a key to prevent this confusion.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Perhaps the Blink RawResource corresponding to the Wasm fetch is keyed by URL leading to the code cache fetch being associated with the first Wasm fetch.<span class="line"><!---->Perhaps the Blink RawResource corresponding to the Wasm fetch is keyed by URL leading to the code cache fetch being associated with the first Wasm fetch.<!----></span><br><br>Another thought is that JavaScript may not have the same problem because they are not explicitly fetched like streaming Wasm resources.<span class="line"><!---->Another thought is that JavaScript may not have the same problem because they are not explicitly fetched like streaming Wasm resources.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146673#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 9, 2020, 8:14 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146673#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 9, 2020, 8:14 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        > My understanding of ResourceLoader is that the code cache fetch is started at the same time as the resource fetch. Is it possible for the second fetch to generate the code and cache it before the first fetch tries to get it?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; My understanding of ResourceLoader is that the code cache fetch is started at the same time as the resource fetch. Is it possible for the second fetch to generate the code and cache it before the first fetch tries to get it?<!----></span><br><br>Yes, that's my understanding too. The fetch (both code cache and the resource) is asynchronous. So, I could imagine the case (though unlikely) where the second fetch is serviced before the first one. Though we match response times to ensure that the cached code corresponds to the fetched resource [1]. So I am not sure how how we could use the wrong code.  Is there a case where the response time matches for the first and second requests? I thought if they are different resources I think response_time would be updated too.<span class="line"><!---->Yes, that's my understanding too. The fetch (both code cache and the resource) is asynchronous. So, I could imagine the case (though unlikely) where the second fetch is serviced before the first one. Though we match response times to ensure that the cached code corresponds to the fetched resource [1]. So I am not sure how how we could use the wrong code.  Is there a case where the response time matches for the first and second requests? I thought if they are different resources I think response_time would be updated too.<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/loader/fetch/resource_loader.cc;l=380;drc=b6ce9909d733600593342da7f9d153d5cd9c532e;bpv=1;bpt=1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/loader/fetch/resource_loader.cc;l=380;drc=b6ce9909d733600593342da7f9d153d5cd9c532e;bpv=1;bpt=1"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/loader/fetch/resource_loader.cc;l=380;drc=b6ce9909d733600593342da7f9d153d5cd9c532e;bpv=1;bpt=1<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146673#c13">Comment 13<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 9, 2020, 1:00 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>

        In the Wasm case, we have to try to retrieve the resource using the URL from the ResourceFetcher.<span class="line"><!---->In the Wasm case, we have to try to retrieve the resource using the URL from the ResourceFetcher.<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/core/v8/v8_wasm_response_extensions.cc;drc=2ac4fdcdc1247f058a77900dc4af2b597a3a60d1;l=210<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/core/v8/v8_wasm_response_extensions.cc;drc=2ac4fdcdc1247f058a77900dc4af2b597a3a60d1;l=210"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/core/v8/v8_wasm_response_extensions.cc;drc=2ac4fdcdc1247f058a77900dc4af2b597a3a60d1;l=210<!----></a><br><br>ResourceFetcher maintains a cache, keyed by URL. So this may be what leads to the type confusion:<span class="line"><!---->ResourceFetcher maintains a cache, keyed by URL. So this may be what leads to the type confusion:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/loader/fetch/resource_fetcher.cc;drc=2ac4fdcdc1247f058a77900dc4af2b597a3a60d1;l=631<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/loader/fetch/resource_fetcher.cc;drc=2ac4fdcdc1247f058a77900dc4af2b597a3a60d1;l=631"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/loader/fetch/resource_fetcher.cc;drc=2ac4fdcdc1247f058a77900dc4af2b597a3a60d1;l=631<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        any chance the cache entry for the first fetch is kept open for the duration for the second? If so, they may end up sharing the entry; a solution may be be to Doom the currently open entry for a key on Write (just dooming it by key before create may be enough and I think should perform OK).<span class="line"><!---->any chance the cache entry for the first fetch is kept open for the duration for the second? If so, they may end up sharing the entry; a solution may be be to Doom the currently open entry for a key on Write (just dooming it by key before create may be enough and I think should perform OK).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 20<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146673#c20">Comment 20<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      jtrro...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->jtrro...@gmail.com<!----></span>

    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, Nov 9, 2020, 11:29 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 9, 2020, 11:29 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146673#c20">Comment 20<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 9, 2020, 11:29 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146673#c20">Comment 20<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Nov 9, 2020, 11:29 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Hi, hope this helps.<span class="line"><!---->Hi, hope this helps.<!----></span><br><br>1. > any chance the cache entry for the first fetch is kept open for the duration for the second? <span class="line"><!---->1. &gt; any chance the cache entry for the first fetch is kept open for the duration for the second? <!----></span><br><br>The first fetch of .wasm resource did not generate any cache, because the web server didn't set any cache control hint in the response HTTP headers.<span class="line"><!---->The first fetch of .wasm resource did not generate any cache, because the web server didn't set any cache control hint in the response HTTP headers.<!----></span><br><br>2. The second time web server would set 'last-modified' in headers and we compile the .wasm resource using `compileStreaming`. In this case, Chrome would cache both the .wasm resource and the compiled wasm code.<span class="line"><!---->2. The second time web server would set 'last-modified' in headers and we compile the .wasm resource using `compileStreaming`. In this case, Chrome would cache both the .wasm resource and the compiled wasm code.<!----></span><br><br>3. Chrome use the URL as key to search existing resource cache, so when compiling .wasm resource fetched in the first time, Chrome would think that there already exists resource cache and then try to get corresponding code cache.<span class="line"><!---->3. Chrome use the URL as key to search existing resource cache, so when compiling .wasm resource fetched in the first time, Chrome would think that there already exists resource cache and then try to get corresponding code cache.<!----></span><br><br>Although the response_time of two fetches are different, Chrome did not verify it before using the code cache. So I think computing a checksum and verify it later, or just verifying the response_time is good enough to fix this bug.<span class="line"><!---->Although the response_time of two fetches are different, Chrome did not verify it before using the code cache. So I think computing a checksum and verify it later, or just verifying the response_time is good enough to fix this bug.<!----></span><br><br>I've tested the fix in #15, it prevents the type confusion and throws a js exception : "Uncaught (in promise) CompileError: WebAssembly.compileStreaming(): Compiling function #5:"get_2" failed: invalid global index: 2 @+46066".<span class="line"><!---->I've tested the fix in #15, it prevents the type confusion and throws a js exception : "Uncaught (in promise) CompileError: WebAssembly.compileStreaming(): Compiling function #5:"get_2" failed: invalid global index: 2 @+46066".<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2"></mr-comment>

        by

      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1146673#c21">Comment 21<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on

        I *think* a malicious web developer can circumvent the time check with service worker.<span class="line"><!---->I *think* a malicious web developer can circumvent the time check with service worker.<!----></span><br><br>// In sw<span class="line"><!---->// In sw<!----></span><br>let flag = true;<span class="line"><!---->let flag = true;<!----></span><br>const init = ...;<span class="line"><!---->const init = ...;<!----></span><br>const bodyA = ...;<span class="line"><!---->const bodyA = ...;<!----></span><br>const bodyB = ...;<span class="line"><!---->const bodyB = ...;<!----></span><br>self.addEventListener('fetch', (e) => {<span class="line"><!---->self.addEventListener('fetch', (e) =&gt; {<!----></span><br>  const req = e.req;<span class="line"><!---->  const req = e.req;<!----></span><br>  if (req.url === ...) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (req.url === ...) {<!----></span><br>    e.respondWith(new Response(flag ? bodyA : bodyB, init));<span class="line"><!---->    e.respondWith(new Response(flag ? bodyA : bodyB, init));<!----></span><br>    flag = !flag;<span class="line"><!---->    flag = !flag;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>});<span class="line"><!---->});<!----></span><br><br>My assumptions (possibly wrong) here is, the response time for a response created in a service worker is always 0.<span class="line"><!---->My assumptions (possibly wrong) here is, the response time for a response created in a service worker is always 0.<!----></span><br><br>This service worker serves two responses for the same URL, and the same response time and different bodies.<span class="line"><!---->This service worker serves two responses for the same URL, and the same response time and different bodies.<!----></span><br><br>+flaken@, please correct me if I'm wrong.<span class="line"><!---->+flaken@, please correct me if I'm wrong.<!----></span><br><br>Thanks,<span class="line"><!---->Thanks,<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I don't immediately know, sorry. I believe the response time check that code caching uses was always meant to be a short-term solution: see <span class="line"><!---->I don't immediately know, sorry. I believe the response time check that code caching uses was always meant to be a short-term solution: see <!----></span>issue 1099587<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1099587" title="Use unique identifier rather than timestamps for verifying V8 code cache entries"><!---->issue 1099587<!----></a>. As<span class="line"><!---->Stop storing the ScriptCachedMetadataHandler in RawResource. As<!----></span><br>RawResource has only one client, we can dispatch the given cached<span class="line"><!---->RawResource has only one client, we can dispatch the given cached<!----></span><br>metadata without compromising ownership. implementation can<!----></span><br>get the handler easily.<span class="line"><!---->get the handler easily.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1146673<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
